meanings.definition: The action or process of giving birth to offspring.
meanings.sent1: The parturitions of the animals at the farm were a beautiful sight to behold.
meanings.sent2: The doctor assisted in the parturitions of many mothers in the maternity ward.
meanings.sent3: The parturitions of the baby animals in the zoo always drew a crowd of excited visitors.
meanings.sent4: The parturitions of ideas in her mind led to a burst of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The parturitions of the flowers in spring painted the fields with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: The act of bringing forth young; childbirth.
meanings.sent1: The parturitions of the puppies brought joy to the whole family.
meanings.sent2: The midwife was experienced in assisting with parturitions of all kinds of animals.
meanings.sent3: The parturitions of the baby birds in the nest were like a tiny miracle every time.
meanings.sent4: The parturitions of new technologies revolutionize the way we live.
meanings.sent5: The parturitions of the stars in the night sky seemed like a celestial dance.
